sailpoint.web

Class WorkItemBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.web.PageCodeBase
      • sailpoint.web.BaseBean
        • sailpoint.web.BaseObjectBean<WorkItem>
          • sailpoint.web.WorkItemBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.faces.component.StateHolder, CertificationBean.SaveListener, sailpoint.web.FormBean, sailpoint.web.FormHandler.FormStore, sailpoint.web.UserContext, sailpoint.web.util.NavigationHistory.Page

    public class WorkItemBean
extends sailpoint.web.BaseObjectBean<WorkItem>
implements CertificationBean.SaveListener, sailpoint.web.util.NavigationHistory.Page, sailpoint.web.FormBean, sailpoint.web.FormHandler.FormStore
    A JSF UI bean that displays and allows working with work items.

    • Field Detail

      • ATT_ITEM_ID

        public static final java.lang.String ATT_ITEM_ID
        Temporary HttpSession attribute where we store the desired WorkItem id to display when transition from random pages. These pages may be using "id" or "editform:id" for their own purposes. Would be better to not use the session but with the JSF issue this is hard. Really need to come up with a framework for doing these sorts of dynamic navigation rules better.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FORM_BEAN_WORKITEM_ID

        public static final java.lang.String FORM_BEAN_WORKITEM_ID

        Constant Field Values

      • isValidViolation

        public boolean isValidViolation()
                         throws GeneralException
        It is possible for a PolicyViolation to be deleted out from under a work item. The page should check this and adjust the form action buttons. Unfortunately there is a lot of code that assumes getViolationViewBean and other methods will return non-null, it is easier to prevent the action buttons than track down all the places that need to check.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • isBusinessCompositionCertification

        public boolean isBusinessCompositionCertification()

        GeneralException

      • getViolationViewBean

        public sailpoint.web.policy.ViolationViewBean getViolationViewBean()
                                                            throws GeneralException
        This bean represents either a standard policy violation certification item, or a PolicyViolation forwarded to the current user from the policy violation viewer. As of 3.2 it is also used for work items created from the example policy workflows. Here, the PolicyViolation will be inside the WorkItem. We could support other conventions here, like "approvalObject" stored in the WorkflowCase and not copied to the WorkItem which is more like how edit approvals work.
        Returns:
        view bean for the policy violation
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getCertificationItemBean

        public CertificationItemBean getCertificationItemBean()
        Return the CertificationItemBean for this work item. This assumes that getBusinessRole(), getException(), getProfile() or getViolation() has already been called.

      • getRequester

        public java.lang.String getRequester()
                              throws GeneralException
        Returns:
        the name of the identity that is considered to be the "requester" of this item. Older work items will have this stored in the WorkItem.requester property. Newer work items created by workflows processed in the background will store the requester name in a variable.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getRoleDifferences

        public BundleDifference getRoleDifferences()
                                    throws GeneralException
        Calculate the differences between the old and new versions of a role. Originally we did diffing of both roles and profiles but in 3.0 you can only have roles. Need to generalize this to diff other kinds of objects.
        Returns:
        the summary of bundle differences
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getTaskResultId

        public java.lang.String getTaskResultId()
                                 throws GeneralException
        The old convention was to leave an "taskResultId" attribute in the WorkItem, we will still recognize that but I am not sure if it is still used, I think it was only for impact analysis.

        The newer convention is to look a the class and target fields of the WorItem to see if it references a TaskResult.

        The fallback if this item has a WorkflowCase is to check for the StandardWorkflowHandler convention of putting the task id in VAR_IMPACT_ANALYSIS_RESULT. We need to think about making it set the WorkItem target.

        Returns:
        the id of a TaskResult associated with this work item.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • setTaskResultId

        public void setTaskResultId(java.lang.String s)
        Need a setter so it can be a hidden field if we post back here but it cannot be changed so ignore it.

      • getWorkflowCaseId

        public java.lang.String getWorkflowCaseId()
                                   throws GeneralException
        Formerly used to control whether to show a link to the modeler to see the pending change. We now use WorkItemBean.getHasPendingChange().
        Returns:
        workflowcase Id
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getDefaultPolicyViolationActions

        public java.util.List<javax.faces.model.SelectItem> getDefaultPolicyViolationActions()
                                                                              throws GeneralException
        jsl - for the 3.2 policy violation workflows, this builds a list of the possible actions as defined on the policy. We might extend this with other custom actions.

        In theory we could try to make this purely data driven from the CertificationActions but we still have the present/past tense problem, CertificationAction keys are past tense (Approved, Revoked) but we need to display present (Approve, Revoke). Consider extending the CertificationAction model to have both keys.

        Returns:
        list of the possible actions as defined on the policy
        Throws:
        GeneralException

        Returns:

        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • forward

        public java.lang.String forward()
        Forward the work item to someone else.

      • reject

        public java.lang.String reject()
                        throws GeneralException
        Return the work item to requester because you will not deal with it.

        jsl - we are overloading a single Reject button for two things.

        For certification work items reject is actually a Return in the WorkItem model, which is an indication that the user has elected not to do anything with the work item. The changes made to the certification model are rolled back.

        For approval work items the concepts of "reject" and "return" are different. Return means "no opinion, give it to someone else" and "reject" means "I don't approve".

        I do not really like the overload but since Reject and Return effectively mean the same thing for certifications, labeling it as "Reject" makes the most sense.

        Throws:
        GeneralException

        public java.lang.String save()
                      throws GeneralException

        GeneralException

      • getMembersGridJson

        public java.lang.String getMembersGridJson()
                                    throws GeneralException
        JSON representatino of the grid metadata for the approval Items grids. Takes request parameters: "page" - The page to display if grid is multi paged "limit" - The number of rows to fetch "sort" - column to sort on "dir" - direction to sort "decision" - work item state. Takes values all/rejected/approved/decided. If null, default to all
        Returns:
        JSON reprensentation of the meta data for approval items grid
        Throws:
        GeneralException
